channel.title: Webclient Problem
channel.description: I made a webclient and when its downloading the cache for them it stops at 98% and says connection error retrying in 5+seconds and it downloads perfectly for me everytime.

item.title: Webclient Problem
item.dc:creator: @FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz
item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:405856”][quote author=FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz link=topic=502845.msg3678965#msg3678965 date=1311398788]
Is there any particular reason why some people can download it but others can’t? I just had my friend try it and it works but when my other friends try it doesn’t work.
[/quote]it’s possible they already have the cache. Have them delete the cache from their local disk c.[/quote]
They try and download the cache and it stops at say 98% and says retrying in 5+ seconds but some of my friends have no problem with it.

Read full topic

I just had my friend try it and it works but when my other friends try it doesn’t work.[/quote]it’s possible they already have the cache. Have them delete the cache from their local disk c.

@imsuperman05 wrote:

yes pm me your id and pass and we can talk

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Problem
item.dc:creator: @FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz
item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:4, topic:405856”][quote author=FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz link=topic=502845.msg3678844#msg3678844 date=1311394879]

Move your cache to desktop, then try to download it and tell me what shows up in the cmd box, when it goes to connection error.

It works perfectly for me but i think part of the reason is that sometimes it says:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\.FormationX\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the file specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:1172) at client.startUp(client.java:9612) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:78) at client.run(client.java:6352) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
But its at the root of my cache folder and the link in the client.java reads it from there.
[/quote]
means you did not zip your cache right, you have to zip all the cache FILES not the folder, i had this problem before.[/quote]
Yeah thats what i did. Do you have skype so i can show you or like teamviewer?

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Problem
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz, post:3, topic:405856”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=502845.msg3678819#msg3678819 date=1311393715]
Move your cache to desktop, then try to download it and tell me what shows up in the cmd box, when it goes to connection error.
[/quote]
It works perfectly for me but i think part of the reason is that sometimes it says:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\.FormationX\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the file specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:1172) at client.startUp(client.java:9612) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:78) at client.run(client.java:6352) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
But its at the root of my cache folder and the link in the client.java reads it from there.[/quote]
means you did not zip your cache right, you have to zip all the cache FILES not the folder, i had this problem before.

item.title: Webclient Problem

item.description:
@FoCuSeD_KiNeTiKz wrote:

imsuperman05:

Move your cache to desktop, then try to download it and tell me what shows up in the cmd box, when it goes to connection error.

It works perfectly for me but i think part of the reason is that sometimes it says:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\.FormationX\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the file specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:1172) at client.startUp(client.java:9612) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:78) at client.run(client.java:6352) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
But its at the root of my cache folder and the link in the client.java reads it from there.
